wikipedia_page.main: William George Verney (1871–1950) was a footballer who made six appearances as a  half-back, scoring once, in the FA Cup for Southampton St. Mary's between 1888 and 1896.

response: * William George Verney (1871–1950) played as a half-back. Described as "a tenacious half-back" who persisted "in his efforts to challenge for every loose ball", he linked up well with William Stride. He remained with St. Mary's until 1896.
